situation.title: Vocational schools
situation.meta_description: Personal attendance in vocational schools is banned by governmental regulations until November 20th, 2020.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Personal attendance in vocational schools is banned by governmental regulations until November 20th, 2020. This means that students can't go to school at this time. Schools established by the Ministry of Justice and schools working alongside establishments for institutional and preventative children's care have an exception.

School practice is suspended except for medical disciplines, which continue in practical training.

The reason is the current epidemiological situation and a high risk of infection. A large number of pupils meet in the classroom for a relatively long period of time, they are also in direct contact with their teachers and parents. This is associated with the risk of transmitting the infection to many contacts.

questions_answers.question: Is practical education being held?
questions_answers.value: No, due to the risk of infection, practical education is suspended except for medical disciplines, which continue in practical training.

questions_answers.question: When will we go back to school?
questions_answers.value: Currently, the ban on in-person education is valid until November 20th. This could be extended if the number of Covid-19 patients does not decrease. Schools are a priority and they will reopen as soon as the situation allows it.
